content:
Nice clash. The only suggestion I would give is that it seems like there should be a test and validator where 0 turbines are at max power, e.g.
6
3000
or
7
2800

A real tricky one for Shortest mode would be something like:
2
100

Because the short solutions tend to define the number of max power turbines needed by c-int((c*1000-e)/500) (where c=turbine count and e=required energy). For the test above, this would give -1, instead of the correct 0.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice clash ! The statement is a bit too long.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Solid problem with great "gotcha" test cases.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good, but I suggest shortening the flavor text to:

"You're an engineer at "Lions Energy Inc." and recently the power turbines have been overworked and have begun breaking. Your new job is to calculate how many turbines should be at Max power in order to meet the energy output, but you cannot turn them all on or they will overheat."

Hello.... in line 12 of your code 
 o >= required_energy

it's always true.... can you add more cases where the RequiredEnergy is not satisfy?
something like: 

Input:
5
14000
Output:
Unstable

All sections
* Please format "TurbineCount" and "RequiredEnergy" as [[variables]].

Input
* Please add "<<Line 1>>: An integer" and "<<Line 2>>: An integer" in front of the relevant descriptions.

Output
* Please format "Unstable" as a {{constant}} and remove the quotation marks.

Game modes
* I don't think it's possible to guess the task in Reverse mode. I suggest to disable that mode.

Cases
* Each test should be similar to its corresponding validator, but not the same. Please revise the cases accordingly.

Stub generator
* Suggest to change "unstable" to "Unstable".

Thanks.
Thank you for your feedback, it was my first time creating a contribution and this helps a lot.

Currently having issues updating my clash on my crappy Wifi (getting a new service soon lol), but I love this idea and I'll be sure to add it. Only thing I'm going to have to change is the constraint on the Turbine Count since 2<5 but I love the gotcha cases :)

Hehe, nice. It's all updated now.

Only thing I feel bad about is now we've conspired to put a tough 'gotcha' as the final test case, and we've all paid the price of clicking 'submit' after seeing >80% of tests pass, only to see a second too late that the final one failed! :P

No problem!

Please follow up these outstanding points:

Input
* Please add "An integer" after "Line 1:".

* Please add "An integer" after "Line 2:".

Constraints
* Please format "TurbineCount" and "RequiredEnergy" as [[variables]].

Thanks.
